My great experience with the previous canon made me choose the Canon in the end. I am very pleased with the camera and picture quality it takes great pics even at low light. I suggest a hard case to protect it from accidentally turning it on. Camera manufactures really should put a lock tab on similar to ipods and id still be using my old one.

Reviews.Title: A Wonder!
Reviews.Author: J. Williams
Reviews.Content: Canon had really out done themselves with this camera.  It's incredibly small, yet full of features.  The two main things that I love about this camera are: 1) The extremely responsive LCD display & menu system.  It doesn't have any  lag/delay, even while indoors, and the display is bright enough to view outside in direct sunlight. 2) The built in red-eye correction really does the job!  And if the camera didn't detect the red eye automatically, you can go into the camera's menu and remove the red eye yourself.  Very handy!What else can I say? I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy and Quick Delivery
Reviews.Author: B. McDonald
Reviews.Content: I looked at all the main stores for the camera and this was the best deal. The camera was new and it was delivered extremely quickly

Reviews.Title: Loved it until it BROKE - Lens error - no more Canons for me
Reviews.Author: Katie - Amazon is my fave store
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera- it was my favorite wedding present I received 15 months ago - I took care of it as if it were gold - then I went to take a picture at a family function and it made a weird motorized sound and said lens error - unfortunately since it was a gift and this person did not buy me an extended plan it was out of warrantee - I brought it to Ritz camera and was told it would cost $134 to repair it and take 4-6 weeks (we are approaching a big holiday season and picture taking season for me but I was still considering on agreeing to the repair)- but the camera repair man told me you can get a great camera for that price and recommended not fixing it - that was shocking to me- then my husband looked up possible fixes on the internet which included 'bang' the camera lens so it retracts and/or blow compressed air around the lens to see if anything is stuck - which more than likely was fuzz from the protective camera bag (not so protective) - we also saw online that there is a class action suit against Canon because this is a common problem that Canon knows about but has not built a better product - so all together- loved the camera - but it did not last long at all - if you get it - get a great extended warrantee - but if you want something that will last - I'd recommend getting a Nikon - I have one that is outdated quality wize (6 MP) but it has lasted for 5 years, so I am using it while I look to purchase a new Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: tikitoo "tikitoo2"
Reviews.Content: I have used a number of different point and shoots (Nikon, Sony and Canon) but I always end up sticking with Canon. I have had every iteration of the Elph line and this camera was an upgrade from the original SD IS, the SD700 IS. While the SD700 is only 6MP it takes great pictures. I have used the SD700 on trips to Italy and London (rather than lug the Canon 20D around) and the image quality is superb. The camera build quality is excellent and solid. I found the SD770IS camera build to be flimsy in comparison. Also, I do not like the slide bar selector at all. I prefer the dial to select camera, view image or record options. As far as picture quality, my SD700IS takes a much better picture. The SD770IS is a much smaller camera than the SD700IS (feels about half the size) but the Elph line is small anyway. I would rather carry a few extra ounces around and have a better built camera. I am returning this and ordering the SD990IS which looks like it may have the same build quality as my SD700IS. I am hoping the image quality is as good as my old SD700IS!

Reviews.Title: Optical View Finder
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can add to the other reviews is a comment on the value of the optical viewfinder. While in France this summer I got careless about halfway thru our two week trip and, with the camera unprotected and probably dangling from my wrist, the LCD got cracked. Without an optical capability we would have had to buy a new camera (expensive over there) or do without. The optical viewfinder on our Elph SD450 saved the day even though we were not able to review the phots on the spot (just take a lot of pictures!).

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction guaranteed with Canon powershot SD770IS
Reviews.Author: V. Are "Hector"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that has wide range of functionality and at a reasonable price. After a lot of research into the point and shoot cameras, I shortlisted 4 cameras namely:SD 750, SD 770, SD 790 & SD 1100. There was not much delay in the operation of the camera and its menu as mentioned in various reviews about the delay in the operation. This works just fine. It takes amazing pictures. The day I bought it, I took some snaps during night in my room with low light and was amazed with this camera's performance. I am good with 2.5' LCD screen so i did not opt for SD790. Otherwise, SD 770 and SD790 are the same with respect to functionality and performance. SD 750 and SD 1100 do not have Image stabilization, So I did not opt for those either. This camera is sleek and is compact and is very easy to carry around and take pics instantly. Image stabilization is excellent. The user interface is very user friendly and an amateur can operate it easily. It has various features like color accent which takes cool pictures. Macro mode takes amazing pics of rain drops, flowers etc. The zoom is good enough and the pictures are crisp even in night after 3x zoom. I would definitely recommend this canon product. Now i am a big fan of Canon brand.

Reviews.Title: Great Canon PS
Reviews.Author: bl13
Reviews.Content: great camera-knew all details before purchase and it has performed. gift for a teenager who is just starting photography. get a good price as they vary.

Reviews.Title: Crap pictures
Reviews.Author: Alas, 'tis I!
Reviews.Content: I changed the subject of this review which had been a little nice.  Too bad you can't change the star rating 'cause I'd drop this to 0 stars.6 coworkers own digital elph cameras and highly recommend them so when my trusty Fuji F700 started to misbehave I decided to give this a go.  I've owned and used this camera for five months now and have taken over 1500 pictures with it.Construction:It looks and feels solid.  Metal all around.  Look and feel are deceiving.  While there are no visible dents or scratches on the outside of the camera (I do not recall having dropped it and I carry it in a Canon hard case) the front and back appear to be separating from the frame.  When turning it on and between shots it will often pop (!) as if internal elements were not properly aligned.  2 stars.Features:It takes pictures and movies.  You can zoom while taking a movie.  You can force the flash to off.  It has auto face recognition and red eye erasing (the latter doesn't work well at all).  It has modes you can set through menus.  The time from when you push the on button to when you see something in the LCD is very short.  It's missing being able to force the flash to on and being able to rapidly take several photos in a row.  The time between normal shots is nearly as long as it takes the camera to start.  2 stars.Image quality:As I wrote above, it's better than a throw-away, but it's certainly not good.  The digital zoom (after the 3x optical zoom) is VERY BAD and gives grainy results regardless of the magnification chosen.  For as much as I spend on this ($240 through Amazon) I expected a good camera.  My F700 didn't cost this much and takes pictures that are orders of magnitude better.  How so?  That is the important thing, isn't it?  OK, it's no good at action shots.  I lock the focus on a solid object that's the distance that the moving object will be.  When the moving object comes along I take the shot.  It takes the camera so long to take a picture that I'm lucky if even a slow moving object is still in the frame by the time the shot actually takes.  It takes bad portraits.  The extra half second it takes to take a shot means that I've lost whatever expression I was looking for.  Movies are not fantastic but come out mostly OK - other than banding and terrible reactions to changing light conditions and sunlight.  I can get decent enough still life shots of subjects that are 3 to 10 feet away as long as light conditions are good (no flash needed).  0 stars.  (Edit down to 0.)Daily use:I bought an extra battery with it.  Well, golly, that wasn't necessary.  I can take more than 100 pictures with it on a full charge.  The lack of features (easy ways to force flash, rafale shooting) contributes to the difficulty of getting good shots.  Time between shots is way too high.  2 stars.Conclusion:It seems fine for a camera that you're not going to care about - to have in your pocket for those moments when you just want a camera.  [Long edit added:  Of course, it only seems that way.  You'll think you've taken decent pictures with it but they are, again, pure and utter crap.  I'm on a job in Australia...  I see amazing things every day.  There isn't even a setting on this piece of garbage to get it to take a decent picture.  Oh, you can get it to take OK pictures of people - but you have to put it in people mode.  What's the point of having a point and shoot camera if you have to program it to get it to do what you want?  Regardless, there isn't any setting for making a forest, landscape, bridge, cityscape, whatever, look nice.  Horrible, horrible, horrible piece of crap.]  You'll have to bear in mind that for those moments the pictures are unlikely to be as good as the moments - but you'll have your memories and they must think that's enough.  This is my third and surely last Canon camera.  -5 stars.Edit:Wow.  I'm stunned at how little people care about the quality of the shot.  This camera is GARBAGE and isn't worth half of what they're charging for it.Edit edit:I'm so angry...  I can't even believe the horrible pictures it took when I was in Sydney!  I should buy another camera while I'm still here - so that at least I'll have a chance to get a few decent pictures of this trip.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Chet
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in 2008 as a Christmas gift for my wife. It's still going strong, and taking great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)
Reviews.Author: Going to the SUN
Reviews.Content: Have been using this Canon PowerShot sd770IS compact digital camera since Feb 2010.  I was hoping the image stabilizer would produce a picture with better resolution.  Camera has been working well with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Darth Syren
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera. It takes great pictures and works perfectly. Never had a problem with it. It is small and it has some neat functions on it.

Reviews.Title: Still love after more than 2 years!
Reviews.Author: Redhead Designer, "C.C."
Reviews.Content: Originally purchased Dec. 2008 and now after more than 2 years, still loving this little camera! Still takes crisp, clean images and is so easy to use. Part of the battery door compartment broke the other day but the battery door still locks in place so I will keep on using it. This is simply a great point and shoot camera with good battery life. Every once and a while I check out the reviews for the newest Canon model available but I still love this camera so much I'm sticking with it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: HPfan
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this camera except the zoom and the slow shutter. When it comes to taking pictures it's too close and doesn't zoom out too far either. The zoom works better while videoing but I rarely use that, I am more into taking pictures. When I am rushing like taking pictures from the  moving car the shutter wouldn't allow me to take it fast unless I leave it on but the battery life is great, so I can leave it on to take fast snaps.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera for the price range and point-and-shoot pocket variety
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I just noticed I never reviewed this camera I got for Christmas last year (2008). Well, let me tell you this is a great camera. Overall, pictures are crisp and sharp, colors are true to life and bright and features are adequate. I have had this for a year after getting during last year's Black Friday sale and have never regretted getting it (especially at a discounted price!)I like that it takes videos with sound, at a resolution more than adequate for YouTube sharing. The response time is pretty decent; you don't need to wait a long time for it to "load" or "reset" in between pictures. It's pretty fast. It also has face recognition, although I'm not sure how useful it really is. This pretty much have the features you'd come to expect from Canon pocket cameras.However, it's not perfect and there are drawbacks. When the flash is turned off, images can get a little blurry. The flash seems to force to camera to focus and when I turn it off (say, I don't want glare reflecting) I have to hold the camera real still or it'll get somewhat fuzzy. If there is natural light and the camera's autoflash doesn't go off, it's not a problem -- only when manually turned off. That's the biggest deficiency. This won't do well in low light settings where you want to capture something far away (try shooting someone at night with the Eiffel Tower lit up behind him) -- but this is a pocket point-and-shoot. In this price range, no camera will excel in low-light situations. (I did get the Eiffel Tower shot, but it was slightly blurry due to the aforementioned issue of blurriness with the flash off). This is mainly a limitation of the price range, not this model.I bought and tried at least four other cameras during Black Friday before picking this one. It was the best, by far. I have come to regard Canon as the top name in digital cameras -- they always seem to deliver on quality. My digital camera before this was a Canon, and I'm sure my next will be, too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point And Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Richardson
Reviews.Content: first off, the battery life on this camera is incredible. this thing holds a charge for the longest time. i don't use it on an everyday basis, @ every 3 days or so, and the battery didnt get charged for @ 250 pictures and didnt really need it then. the charger is a really compact, folding plug in charger that is simple to use and store - keep it in the case with the camera or you might lose this little compact charger. the camera itself is sturdy and great looking. the screen is large for the cameras compact size. the picture quality is absolutely amazing! this is the best compact that i've ever used, bar none. you can't go wrong with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Marisa
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect to throw in your purse when you do not want to carry a larger camera, you barely know it is there.The pictures are really good quality, with colors that are nice and vibrant and I have made some good prints for friends, since I bring this to birthday parties, BBQs and other get togthers.I usually just leave it in full automatic mode because of how well it does with that, but there are some other settings you can change if you need to.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: R. Brown
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a previous model that I loved! I took it with me everywhere and it finally died. So I got this one, and it is every bit as good. It is everything I want in a little point-and-shoot digital camera.I put a screen protector on this one because I noticed the screen getting scuffed and scratched on my other one during my rock climbing, backpacking, and other daily and high adventures. But a reliable, perfect little camera!

Reviews.Title: Terrific point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jason Bradley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to use for taking photos of our new baby. After having this camera recommended by a friend I picked it up on Amazon.com. The camera feels and looks solid and has a bright large LCD screen on the back. The camera is dummy proof and takes sharp images with out any manual adjustments. My only complaint is that it uses proprietary batteries.

Reviews.Title: Good One
Reviews.Author: Vimal Muthu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera through amazon(I think source is VL camera) on a good deal.It is a great camera.very handy and very good clarity.I love it.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Sam H.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take snapshots of people and places while traveling. I've had it for 3 months now and love it. Takes great pictures, images and colors come out clean and crisp. Comes with good features, including contiuous shooting mode, black and white, sepia, and other color accent features. I get a lot of red eyes in pictures, but camera has an automatic red-eye correction feature which works wonderfully. I especially like that in addition to the large screen, it has a view finder, which is hard to find now in small cameras. Battery lasts a long time. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great camera for it's size
Reviews.Author: Sona Petrosyan "Sona"
Reviews.Content: good picture quality, pretty decent functionality selection. I also have Nikon D60 SLR camera, and interchangeably taking pictures with both of them. Of course you can see the difference in quality, but still the cannon SD770IS pictures looks pretty good next to professional camera pics.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew Locke
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip around South America and couldn't be happier with how it worked.  Excellent battery life, fair amount of options for those who don't have much experience taking pictures and the quality of the pictures were consistently good.  Especially like the fact that it easily fit in my pockets and the fact that the battery charger had the plug built into it, therefore not requiring a separate cord.  Camera also records decent video.  For an all around camera, I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little machine!!
Reviews.Author: K. Morris "professional student"
Reviews.Content: I Love my ubiquitous Canon digital elph. I had the oh so common sd750 but I misplaced / lossed it which gave me an excuse to upgrade to this one at the great price of 149.00 and I am glad that I did. In addition to taking excellent pictures. It is very user friendly, now I know how to change the settings in a snap depending on what picture situation I am in.The video capabilities are also fabulous and look great. I had been eyeing a flip mino then I said to myself that would be just a waste of money because my camera record vids just as conveniently and sure nough. the vids taken on here look much better than the flips vids do. I have a 2 gb SD card that hold tons of pix and video depending on what quality you select. if you select the best quality you can take up to 550+ pics which is fine with me. I can always get a 4gb card or upload the pics to my computer and start over. The ease of storage with the standard SD cards is a plus as well. I can go on and on but if you purchase this camera, it definately will not dissapoint. I have owned cameras that were 3 times the price of this one and this one blows them all out of the water.

Reviews.Title: great but still learning how to use it.
Reviews.Author: Kristen "Kristen"
Reviews.Content: Had this for 6 months and I am still learning all the features. Its a great compact little camera though. Love the option where you can focus on just one color.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Monica R. Dos Santos
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on January and I never had any problem. It is perfect: small, light, beautiful and it takes wonderful (well defined) pics.I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: J. Kougl
Reviews.Content: I only buy Canon cameras because I'm used to their functionality and they are such great quality. This didn't let me down in the least bit! Excellent in every way . . . easy to use, perfect size, takes amazing quality photos. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Krishna Madduri
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago and it has been a fun using this small yet powerful camera.  It has all the features that u expect from a compact camera, the video clarity was better than my expectations (not when you zoom it though :D).  It has some cool modes such as color accent and color swap which snap mind blowing photos if used properly.  The clarity of the photos is very good and the battery life is great.  It definitely is a very good deal for its price.cons: 3x zoom doesn't satisfy ur needs to the fullest, but its okay as  compact cameras are not meant for large zoominIn short its powerful and best amongst its genus.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mitesh Parikh
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for most people who are just looking for good pictures with friends, family, and when sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: N. Barron
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Does everything I expected it to. Takes clear, crisp pictures and good videos with good quality sound. Easy to use and a good small size. Great for vacations and just every day pictures.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot SD770IS
Reviews.Author: MV( Mitchelville, MD USA)
Reviews.Content: This digital camera is so user friendly. The instructions are easy to follow, even first time users will love it. I like the clear pictures, It`s an amazing little camera,so handy, fits in your pocket.This is a good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: fabulous camera
Reviews.Author: C. Kelly
Reviews.Content: At the recommendation of a friend, I purchased this camera for a trip to Paris, and for that I will be forever grateful. This is an excellent camera, and an excellent price!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Jen "Jen"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  Very good pictures for a point and shoot.  Main complaint is speed, which is an issue with any camera in this range.  The IS works great.  Not fast from shot to shot, but not bad for a small camera.  Will work great for most people.  Very small and can easily be put in purse or pocket.  When I need or want a great picture, the DSLR comes out.  But who can carry a big camera around all the time?  Never use the viewfinder on this thing.  It is a joke.  Okay screen on the back.  Mine had one pixel out, but no big deal.  Pictures about the same as a Panasonic camera that I have.  Panasonic cameras take great pictures too, but the blades wear out and don't open and close after about a year or so.  I think Canon will hold up better in this area.  If you are looking for a point and shoot.  This is the best for price right now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Colleen Renee Kay "BigSlink"
Reviews.Content: This is a quality camera with many useful features. I am thoroughly enjoying it. I bought it as a Gold Box Deal so it was a bargain that I couldn't pass up. Highly recommended for a casual user like me.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Sergio A. Mercado
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this purchase. Bought this for my wife and she enjoys the compact/lightweight design--easy to store in any size purse or pocket. The camera itself takes excellent photographs on any mode--but it is easy to use for anyone who doesn't want a technically difficult/advance camera. A Nice alternative to our SLR.Pros: Easy to use, excellent photos on all light settings, stylish design--does the job perfectly. Great battery life also. Cons: a wide angle lens would have been nice, but to Canon's credit I believe the next model up (880) incorporates this feature (?). Also, greater zoom power would have been nice.  Overall 9.50 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: David Dare
Reviews.Content: This is the third point and shoot that I've owned.  This is light, compact, and takes a better photograph than my previous cameras.  There are a lot of settings and I still haven't figured out how to best utilize them to achieve the best pictures in various situations.  I have had some problems with red-eye, even with the red-eye reduction features turned on.  You can't take pictures very quickly; at least a few seconds before you can take sucessive shots.  The battery life is nice as I took over 700 pictures in three days and only had to charge a little bit during the last day.  I purchased a 4GB card to go with it.  I've been able to get very nice detail on really close photographs, much better than I expected.  This camera isn't designed for distance, so if you're photographing more than about 20 feet away, you're not going to zoom in tight on something.

Reviews.Title: The best point-and-shoot on a budget
Reviews.Author: Leslie A. Bonifay "Casual photographer"
Reviews.Content: I spent MONTHS researching dozens of point-and-shoot cameras.  My main concern was reproduction of images (a Kodak I received as a gift was horrible) and image quality indoors.  So far, I've been more than pleased with the results of my Canon PowerShot SD770.  It's a wonderful everyday/everywhere camera.  I also consulted three professional photographers for their opinions, and all said I couldn't go wrong with Canon.Overall, if you're looking for a great on-the-go camera and you're on a budget, you can't go wrong with this little Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Good Pocketablity, Perfect for Budding Photogs
Reviews.Author: J. D. Korwek "Vids, Pics, and Tricks"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for two main reasons, it was cheap and it had good reviews.Both were dead on, The price is ~200$or less(depending on when you're reading this.)Exactly what a 3x optical 10MP camera should go for.  Having Image Stabilization and being made by Canon didn't hurt either. (I trust Canon over most any body for cameras)The camera is light weight and a good size. I have big hands so most any point and shoot feels tiny, this one is good.  All the controls are in the "right" spot just under the thumb easy reach for fast access.Speaking of controls, it offers a lot of manual options I didn't expect long shutter, manual iso, exposure, etc. Not as many on a SLR but still good for a sub 200$ P&S.;Power up to first shot time was incredibly fast, not fast enough to catch a once in a lifetime moment but still quick. For those once in a lifetime moments use the viewfinder and turn the display off, have a continuous shutter (1.4fps till the card is full) and you're goldenThe battery life is good, I haven't charge the battery too often, though I don't use it every day. But it doesn't run down in 10 minutes like some cameras can.I say get the SD770IS while its available and under $200, it's a perfect deal for a budding photographer or just as a snap shot camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD770IS
Reviews.Author: Walter Wojcik
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)I used a few friends older SD canon models and like them. They were happy with them, so I bought a new one for myself. So far I love it, pix are great and camera couldn't be easier to use.

Reviews.Title: Bad indoor photos
Reviews.Author: A. Yee "IT Professional"
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it is the settings, but I've tried them all - infinity, not, no flash, flash, night, auto, etc. and photos were VERY dark.  I was disappointed as I've had trouble finding a good P&S; that does indoor photos adequately in a conference room.  Then the Canon is worse than Panasonic lumix and Olympus that I own.  I'd be willing to change the review stars (which made me buy yet another camera in the first place), but it's not obvious how to get the settings to do a decent indoor photo of people who are not just right in front of you.  Otherwise, I like the compact camera and video but the delay between photo takes were too slow as well, and I'm not using hi-res or hi-pixels.  thx.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Farwell
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. I've owned several small cameras in the past but nothing as good as this one. It has exceeded my expectations. I needed to make a sketch of a building from a picture I had taken with this camera, so I made a 11"x14" print to sketch from. The print turned out beautifully: the exposure was right-on, the colors were good and all the fine details were there - even the letters in the street and building signs were clear and sharp. And there was no visible grain in the print.In addition to producing sharp pictures, I was also pleased to discover that it comes with a high capacity battery  - 300+ images per charge. I wanted a camera with a view finder to use when the day light is so bright it's hard to see the images in the LCD screen. Although this camera has a very good, bright LCD screen, I've found occasionally that it is necessary to use the view finder on bright days. Another thing I like about this camera is that I can carry it with me, at all times, either in my picket, or on my belt in the case that was designed for it. The lens is fairly fast (2.8) at wide angle setting, a desirable feature, since it helps with low light exposures. I have not had any problem with shutter lag. Maybe what pleases me the most is that I was able to buy it at a great price!Any complaints? It would be nice to have a lens with a little more telephoto length, but if the trade-off is either the faster lens (f2.8), or more telephoto length (150mm), I'd opt for the faster lens.  I found the printed manual to be difficult to use. Many of the camera's features are not covered in the index in the back of the manual. I found it was hard to track down information. So I really don't have much to complain about. In my judgment, Canon has done a remarkable job with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Just as advertised
Reviews.Author: J. A. Hyer
Reviews.Content: There isn't much I can add to the already great reviews on this fantastic product, but I will try.Fit, function, and feel of this camera is all top notch.  Service from Amazon was great and I have no complaints.Searching the web I found this camera slightly cheaper elsewhere, but with overcharged shipping and handling fees it brought the price in line with what Amazon was charging with free shipping.The only recommendation I have for people purchasing this product is to find a clear screen protector for the LCD.  The screen gets very smudged with finger prints.  Surprisingly the screen doesn't come with even a cheapy thin one out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: The Reader
Reviews.Content: Just love this camera.It is nice and light and takes great pictures.Easy to use.  Has a nice large area to see your pix.Fits in the smallest handbag.No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: A great step up
Reviews.Author: Befragt
Reviews.Content: By way of background, we got this camera as a gift replacement for our old Nikon Coolpix L1.  The L1 was, well, not so great - the software that came with the camera sucked, there was significant shutter lag, the camera seemed to take forever between pictures, and it began to fall apart all too soon after we bought it.The PowerShot is a refreshing upgrade.  Although the Nikon is fairly small, the Powershot easily fits in the palm of any adult's hand.  Indeed, one potential criticism is that the camera may be too small for some people with large hands to use effectively; however, it works fine for both my wife and me.The zoom lens on the Powershot is arguably a step back from our old Nikon since it only goes to 3X optical zoom rather than 5X.  That being said, it comes with some good image stabilization, motion detector, and other features our old camera lacks.  And as far as picture quality, there's no comparison - the Powershot is better.Serious photographers should undoubtedly spring for more elaborate camera.  That being said, if you like to photograph kids, friends and family, this lightweight, easy to use camera provides some good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Good quality photos but not totally intuitive process
Reviews.Author: DC barb
Reviews.Content: The camera is good but i did have to rely on the instructions quite a bit plus the memory card was ridiculous in size.  I could barely get 10 shots on there so had to go back and order another memory card.  I also had trouble getting Butterfly to respond to emails.  I think my next electronics purchases will be done in person.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Eaes
Reviews.Content: Edit: At the time of editing, the 790IS (with a 3" LCD) is only one penny more. I doubt I'll ever use the viewfinder on this camera, so I would have preferred the 3" LCD. The controls do look slightly clumsier to me, though.This is a great camera. It's about the size of a pack of cards, and ways about the same (actually, it's a bit smaller and lighter now that I compare them in each hand). Definitely a quality build, although the card/battery door is flimsy. Auto mode works really well, and the image stabilization gets crisp shots even if I shoot one-handed (the controls are also workable with one-hand if you're not doing a lot of shot to shot adjusting, which is nice). I charged the battery when I got it, took about 2 hours... I've shot around 100 pics with flash and I've still got a full battery.It resolves detail pretty well, and even without flash indoors I can get crisp shots after a few tries. I'd get a tripod if you actually intend to do a lot low-light shooting, IS isn't enough. You won't even see camera shake in good lighting, though, which is much more important to me.The flash works pretty well, I was surprised.. I'll upload a pic of it if I can. The exposure on the faces works really well. Read the manual and set things up, and you'll love it.The camera focuses at about a 9 inches normally, and as close as an inch at the wide-end in macro mode.Color accenting/other image editing options all work well. I'm a graphic designer, so I wasn't that interested, but it's kind of fun to be able to instantly take stylized photos. Also, you can set it up to save both the edited and original picture, which is great. These aren't nearly as powerful as actual editing software, of course, but they work pretty well. You can set the tolerance level to a limited extent, so that you can choose one color, or colors near it, and keep expanding. In most of the shots I took, these options were sufficient for the desired effect.Panorama Stitching seems to work really well, I like it. Again, being a designer, I don't have a lot of use for it.Caveats:--LCD is a little small. I'd prefer the later model's design--no viewfinder and a larger LCD. Still, it's bright and easy to see.--Lens could've gone a little wider.. I think the later model corrected this as well.--Camera's should come with LCD protector. It's not like they're expensive, and I'm afraid to leave with this in my pocket without one. (EDit: I got minor scratches before putting the protector on, they're not noticeable, but it's a pain. The protector I got was just a cheap screen thing from Walmart. If they have one for the SD770, I recommend getting an EXiM SPUC protector from Ebay. I have one for my D40 which works beautifully, and was obviously custom made for the model.)--No cord for the battery adapter. They apparently changed the model, and it now must plug directly into an outlet.. and it's very wide. A slight pain if you use a surge protector, as it takes at least 2 plugs no matter how I put it on there (rather than setting the plug on one side, it's dead center).--No raw option.. or at least I can't find it. Not really sure why it wasn't included. Not a big deal, since the jpeg's don't seem to compressed and still look stunning, but since I do design I typically prefer using the highest fidelity input source possible. If it's there and I'm just overlooking it, someone help me out :-)Overall, this is a great, VERY lightweight, low-profile camera. I keep it on me all the time. It turns on fast--I can get the camera on, auto-calibrated, and a good shot in about three seconds. The shutter-lag is beyond my perception--meaning when I shoot I get exactly what I meant to. It's a problem shooting with flash though, because the orange light is really annoying, and people will turn to look at it. Real photographers will have an SLR for that, but it's a pain for me. I really like low-light photography, so I'm getting one for that, but I'll still carry this everywhere just for convenience.

Reviews.Title: Hard to please
Reviews.Author: Brian Frost
Reviews.Content: I usually shoot with an SLR and a higher end canon lens.  Ive been keeping a casio exelim (consumer reports pick which I rate as 1 star) as a pocket camera for when the slr was too big to carry.  I also shot a week with a small nikon and an older canon s series P&S; camera.  I am tough to please but know I cant always carry my SLR.  I just spent a month in Thailand with this camera (with underwater housing) and my SLR.  I couldnt be more thrilled with the quality of shots I get from this camera.  Many of them rival my SLR in well lit situations.  It has the ability to drag the shutter, manually change the iso, and even custom white balance for underwater shots.  Yes it has higher noise at high iso's but so do all small cameras. Yes it could be faster at recovering and snap pictures more responsively, but I have never had a pocket sized camera that was better in those regards. The images that come from this camera look so good I can forgive the small issues which seem to be a part of every other camera of this class. The 770is is amazing for the size/money.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Lori A. Aberle "Lors"
Reviews.Content: I almost bought the Nikon Cool pics... And people I knew and sales people at electronic stores said the Canon is much better pics...  I really love mine and the price on Amazon is so mucy cheaper.. Yay

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: I read countless reviews before buying this camera and I am so happy with it. Great pictures, great video, great screen, fast, small, excellent value...the list goes on. I am a point and shoot photographer and I get excellent shots with this camera. And, the macro function is phenomenal, great for taking pictures of cool bugs and such (I live in Costa Rica and there are so many cool insects here!). Everyone that I know that has a Canon absolutely loves it!

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good.
Reviews.Author: Gnat Arson
Reviews.Content: I like this camera better than the SD790 and its less expensive.  Ignore reviews from such sites as Cnet and PC Mag.  They compare point and shoot cameras with DSLR's and their opinions are biased.  As far as rating it within the point and shoot category, the SD770 is stellar.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel N. OConnor
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my teenage daughter who loves to take pictures of all her friends.  Her biggest complaint with earlier camera was the speed and battery.  This uses a rechargeable battery, and resets for rapid fire photos so she can take lots of action shots of her friends without waiting between flashes.

Reviews.Title: Perfect compact camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "demon"
Reviews.Content: This tiny little camera is amazing - I could not believe just how feature-packed yet compact this 10MP camera is, and more importantly, it takes great pictures! I purchased this as a birthday gift for my g/f and she absolutely loves it - she drops it in her bag/purse whenever she goes out.recommendations:The camera does not come with a case or any sort, but I can recommend this one: Caselogic UNZ-2 Small Universal Pocket w/Screen Protection (Black/Silver) which was only $12 (including shipping) when I purchased it, and worth it at twice the price. The SD770IS camera fits perfectly into this sturdy and protective case, yet my g/f is happy with having it in her purse - no bulk at all.The camera comes with only a minimal 32MB memory card - barely big enough for a handful of pics. I strongly recommend the following card: Kingston 8 GB SDHC Class 6 Flash Memory Card SD6/8GB - at under $15 it's a great deal; you'll never run out of space, and it has a slightly higher speed as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, great price, wonderful upgrade from our SD500
Reviews.Author: A4Q96 "Gadget Lover"
Reviews.Content: I broke our Canon SD500 two weeks before vacation, so I needed a replacement fast.  It came down to this camera, the SD880, and SD1100.  At the end of the day, this was priced the same as the SD1100 with more features, and was almost $100 less than the SD880.  Given how quickly these cameras change and improve, I figured ~$150 was totally worth it.  SD Memory cards have also come down in price, so I splurged ($30 :) ) for a 16GB SD card.I did a lot of research prior to selecting this camera, and suggest that you are VIGILANT before selecting a Canon PowerShot.  PowerShot these days refers to a huge # of different cameras that have different body styles (and a huge variation in size of their casings) and varying capabilities.We chose this camera for1)  compact size2)  relatively few negative reviews, suggesting durability was not a big issue.3)  positive experience with the SD500, which was a similar size4)  Digital zoom for situations where you can't get as close as you'd like5)  Price - it was only $159 (I don't know what is going on these days - several of the sites are selling it for $335! - way too much!)We took over 1000 pictures (!) on a trip to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic and the card and camera were still going strong.  The pictures turned out beautifully, and the camera was a breeze to use.  Quick shutter speed (you could click off 10 shots rapid fire in daylight, and response time was pretty good even in lower light.  The video setting takes surprisingly good video, too.All in all, a great find.UPDATE JULY 2009:Here are some additional details on positives/negatives with this camera:Key positives are:1)  Great picture quality...  Several thousand pictures in, we have been more than satisfied.  10MP's seems to give you more flexibility when zooming and in lower light.  We have these pictures turn out very well.2)  3x Optical Zoom and Digital Zoom - the digital zoom has worked very well for us in situations where we cannot get as close as we would like.3)  Good battery life (with the Canon OEM battery)4)  Good video - that has been an added bonus.  We take almost all our video with this camera and almost never carry our digital camcorder these days.5)  HUGE picture capacity.  The Kingston 16 GB SDHC Class 4 Flash Memory Card is great and I have never come close to filling it (despite 1000+ pictures on the camera at certain times).  I guess I can't give the camera full credit for this one.Negatives1)  Can't turn the flash on manually - there is a flash toggle button that goes between "flash off" and "auto flash".  When I toggle to auto flash, there are still times the flash does not go off (might be user error, but this is annoying.  The SD500 had a "flash on" setting.  Doesn't seem like a confusing thing to provide2)  Sometimes slow in lower light - in some cases where you are trying to get that "perfect shot", the camera's setup time to take the shot is a bit annoying.  I find you have to press the shutter switch halfway down to get it to get in focus, and wait in that mode or you will miss a shot.  Somehow, it seems slower to me than our old SD500 now (when I initially posted, I had taken mostly daylight shots and hadn't seen this problem.)All in all, love the camera, have gotten great use out of it, and would buy another Canon.One more thing - strongly recommend the following Case Logic Semi-Hard case to protect it:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000VVZ09O/ref=oss_T3_productthe case fits in a pocket easily and is very compact.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD770IS
Reviews.Author: I. Hill
Reviews.Content: Had a Kodak will never go back. It started acting up witin 18 months. This has features I am still exploring and find very easy to manipulate. Could not believe the picture of the full moon taken with the telescopic feature at night. It was something that you would have that had been taken by an expert (not me) with and high powered SLR.

Reviews.Title: yeeaah BOI!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Mineo
Reviews.Content: LOVE the "macro" function... It allows you to focus in on certain objects while blurring out the surrounding ones, creating great depth shots. I really wanted a nice cannon rebel SLR... but i didn't want to spend all that money, plus i didn't want to cary it around... this point and shoot is a nice medium, real high quality pictures, some advanced features, and pretty simple. [...]

Reviews.Title: Researched for Two Months; Very Impressed!!
Reviews.Author: David Gunty "E39Dave"
Reviews.Content: I am new to Digital Photography, but was still very careful and deliberate about this last camera purchase. I looked at all of the 'Black Friday' ads, searched multiple sites, and this is the best camera out there for the money. I picked it up at Amazon at the $160 price point w/ free shipping. I later bought a 4G SD Card for less than 8 bucks, which is absolutely neccessary and plenty big. Here are a couple of the big points for me:10 MP for less than[....]SUPER Battery! I charged it full the day I recieved it, took hundreds of Pics and lots of video, using the the Camera every few days and the battery lasted 3 FULL WEEKS!! I kept wondering when the Battery would wind down. Really impressed. I let it run completely dead; as I have heard that this increases the life/performance of the Battery.Durable camera with big clear display, feels real solid!Easy functions #I haven't had to crack open the book yet#Quick reaction for first and subsequent pics. No lag between completing a video and being able to watch it. Hooks right up to TV to watch it!The picture quality seems really good to me, but I am not a pro, so my opinion regarding picture quality should be taken as such. The video quality is good too, but gets a little grainey when you zoom with video.I had thought about an SLR, but I'll do that later. This isn't SLR quality photography, but the pics look great! This fact, plus all the stuff mentioned above make it the best "all-around" little camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: Virginia D. Green
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this camera. I love taking pictures on vacations and blowing them up to frame..and this camera's high quality photos are perfect for that. The camera itself is so small, light, and easy to use..so it's also perfect for slipping in my clutch to bring out at night. I have NEVER seen a camera with such a long battery life- it's unbelievable! I have used mine for a month, taking about 1,000 photos and a few videos, and it STILL has 3 out of 3 battery bars. I can't get over that. I highly recommend this camera for anyone!

Reviews.Title: If you need a Point and SHoot camera, that's what you are looking for!!!
Reviews.Author: Evren Rahimov
Reviews.Content: I bought Sony Cybershot W150, after I took 10-15 photos, I was frustrated. My friend said the photos were nice and that I expected too much from it. For an ordinary person who wants just small sized photos, they were really nice. But not for me, I am a photo maniac. I want to see everything clearly when I zoom 3, 4, or 5 times!!! So, I decided to but this one. It was on me all the time during my Washington, Philadelphia, New York and Norfolk trips this Winter. I really enjoyed taking photos with this camera, it is awesome!!! I am using Superfine mode, and Large(10MP) mode and the photos came out really cool! The only "bad" thing about this is that, they are too big, and now the size of my folder with the photos from my trip is over 8 GB!!! But I have lots of photos, and now I am enjoying them! :) Besides, the video quality of the camera is also awesome. When my friend using Sony Cybershot W150 saw the video I recorded, he said: "It is nice, you don't have any "small squares" in this video". I don't want to say that "Sony Cybershot w150 is bad, don't go for it", I DO NOT SAY THAT! I just share my experience, maybe you will like Sony better, just try both of them before buying. I don;t know how yours will be, but my choice is Canon 770 IS!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: For the amateur photographer, Perfect.
Reviews.Author: Brett Vanleeuwen "Brett"
Reviews.Content: After a few days of review, I went ahead and bought this camera for my girl friend.  With herself not ever owning a camera or being that big into electronics, this goes above and beyond all her needs.Accompanied with an 8GB SD card, that can store 30min of video, with thousands upon thousands of images, at highest resolution--she was very excited.The camera turns on in about .5 seconds, I am not kidding.  It is extremely fast to turn on.  But the bad, it takes about 3-4 seconds from FULLY pushing down the button to:  Shine red light, focus, then finally take the picture.  3-4 seconds to do all that.  So if you want to take a picture and it's in your pocket, you've got about 4 seconds of waiting, that is, if you are quick.So a way around this, is to half-way hold down the button (which focuses the camera in 3 seconds), then pushing it another half-way takes the picture instantly, virtually just as fast as a camera with film.Its got lots of fun features...  We've had fun with the 'color accent.'  For example, at christmas, we went up to a tomato, pointed the camera at it, put the tomato inside the little rectangle on the screen, then push the left arrow (grabs the color).  After you have the color you want, take a picture!  The photo is a black & white shot, with the tomato the only thing in the picture with color!  Actually looks really cool.  That was a 'oooo' & 'ahhh'er.One gripe that high end users will see, is that low light, high ISO photos are not great.  Good at best.  Not only are the photos grainy & noisy, but the screen shows HIGH levels of noise too!  However, turn on the flash, and that fixes the problem, but the issue remains: high ISO images are highly saturated with noise.  Good thing most users will not notice this.My last camera was a LUMIX, which was a great camera, but I think I coughed up around $500 for that.  This is better than that 2 yr old camera, for a fraction of the cost.I gave this camera a 5, for fun features, GREAT image quality (with lots of light; day time), Good image stabilization, great battery life, & a perfect price.

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Jessica Sams
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon camera user for a while now and have yet to be disappointed by their products.  For the past few months, I had been searching for a new digital camera to replace my older, bulkier camera.  After doing a lot of research (in stores, on-line, asking random people with cameras in their hands), I decided on the Canon PowerShot SD 770 because of its size and its available functions.  The manual for the camera is well written, which made it easy to find the functions and play with the options.  I am impressed at how much technology has been crammed into this little camera.  For anyone who wants an easy-to-use small camera that has the ability to do some photoshopping elements (such as getting rid of red eye; changing colors of objects; changing color hues to better capture pictures of nature, sunsets, and snow), you need to look into this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the average user
Reviews.Author: ss "ss"
Reviews.Content: * Takes solid shots* Never anything blurry* Easy to use* The "auto" feature that figures out what the best setting is, is a blessing* perfect for family outings, in-ings* perfect for people like my teenage sister who love to take pictures of themselves...haaaaaaaa

Reviews.Title: a review for novices like me
Reviews.Author: L. Steiner
Reviews.Content: I love this SD770 because it's so easy to use and takes great pictures. I'm not an expert photographer, so I just use Auto Mode for now, and the pictures come out great. It's so easy, even my husband can take great pictures. I especially like the large 2.5-inch LCD which is beautiful, and the fact the SD770 has a view finder, something hard to find on cameras nowadays. The Optical Image Stabilizer also works great, and the battery lasts a long time. I don't think I could find a better camera for around $150. It's so small and lightweight at 4.6 ounces, I take it with me all the time and have excellent pictures from my travels. I highly recommend this camera, and suggest you read the product information on this camera's page, I wish all electronic products made it so easy to understand each feature.

Reviews.Title: This is a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Megan B. Moore
Reviews.Content: It was time for us to upgrade, and I looked at alot of different cameras.  I decided I wanted something with options but could use it in just an automatic mode, and something compact.  I narrowed it down to Canons.This camera is lovely.  It takes clear, beautiful pictures.  It was very easy to figure out.  The screen is nice and big to view pictures.  It is easy to turn the flash on and off.  It isn't bigger than a stack of cards.I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: ccasper
Reviews.Content: Very awesome camera.  Bought it to replace my lost Kodak Easy Share from a few years ago and I'm very impressed.  It has much better picture quality, starts up in no time (my Kodak took a good 5 seconds to be ready to shoot), and is lighter from not having AA batteries in it.  It's smaller than my iPhone, so it definitely qualifies as compact!  I can't wait to get a lot of use out of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Needed
Reviews.Author: Moiz Malik "Syxx"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to replace the Canon that I lost. I just need a camera for casual use, a few group shots here and there, nothing major. This camera fulfills that perfectly, and got it for a great price on black friday along with the free sd card.

Reviews.Title: great experience
Reviews.Author: lilamps
Reviews.Content: I am a novice at photography but i think this camera takes good pictures in spite of your inexperience. It has quite a lot of functions and that gives the user a lot of work to do in trying to get accustomed to it but i am so glad i bought it.Its worth so much more than it cost!

Reviews.Title: great value for great pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Walker
Reviews.Content: pic quality is excellent, movies are just as good.  discovered that there were 2 different time-lapse features for video as well... very cool to play around with.  this camera has exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: AVOID CANON AT ALL COSTS, disposable camera
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: PROS: portable, nice images, extensive features for a point-and-shootCONS: longevity of less than a year, poor customer serviceYes, it's small in size, large in features, and takes very nice pictures.  But in less than a year, this camera has been rendered functionally useless.  Following just 10 months of normal usage, it no longer takes still shots (but works on video) and intermittently fails to turn on.  Canon's 1-yr warranty was still in effect -- we were grateful at first -- but this proved to be a false hope.  After an initial notice of "this will be promptly repaired for you," a few days later Canon's customer (dis)service CONVENIENTLY found corrosion damage from water(?!), which we dispute completely, and declined to repair it.  Either this camera is susceptible to condensation from sitting in a dry pocket or Canon is dishing out horse manure while slithering off the hook -- we suspect the latter.Couple the poor reliability of this camera with disingenuous warranty service, and suddenly Canon has lost us as a faithful customer.  We'll look at Nikon, Pentax, and plenty of other worthy competitors instead.  We urge you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: Sleek, Compact, Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Jonas Mom "JonasMom"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Canon SD770IS from Amazon.com because of the great offer (70% off original price) plus it came with a special offer for a free 4GB memory card and oh yeah, extra battery for a special price just for purchasing the camera. Overall, it was a steal (free shipping & no taxes, yeah!) and of course an awesome camera. Always loved CANON cameras! Great pictures especially when you have child who can't seem to sit still. Great at nite and indoors.Can't wait to use for the upcoming Holidays and birthdays!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Mommyof4boys
Reviews.Content: This camera is completely amazing!  The pictures are very crisp and clear, and it's easy to use.  The 10 mega pixels are perfect for zooming in on an object and then cropping the picture.  The camera is nice and small and fits easily in my purse.  I bought it from Amazon for the lowest price around.  In the box is the camera, battery pack, battery charger, interface cable, AV cable, 32MB memory card, wrist strap, software CD, and warranty card.  I download pictures to my computer without any problems.  (I have a new iMac 2.8 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo running Mac OS 10.5.5.)  I didn't even need to install Canon's software.  Instead I use either iPhoto or Image Capture to download the pictures.  Since the memory card that comes with the camera is only 32MB, I purchased an 8GB memory card from newegg.com for only $13.99 (Transcend 8GB Secure Digital High-Capacity SDHC Flash Card).  It can hold nearly 1800 pictures at the largest/finest 10 mega pixel size!  Can't beat that!All in all, this is a great camera!  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot elph cameras
Reviews.Author: Garry A. Smith
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the SD770Is.  I had previously purchased the Canon Power shot SD 450 about 2 years ago. It is the best camera I have ever had including several high end SLR's. The pictures it takes are suberb. Since I paid over $300 for it, the SD770Is at about half the price and with advanced features and still the small size seems like a no-brainer. I am not a camera nerd, but I do appreciate clear easy taken photos and these cameras are outstanding. The movie option also is a real plus for a camera this size. The SD elphs are exceptionally well built of aluminum and not the plastics used in cheaper competitive cameras. The ease of recharging the batery with the plug in re-charger is awsome. My SD 450 has (only) 5 mega Pixels and the photos are so clear that you wonder how they could ever be improved.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Sus
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Although I'm not a professional photographer, I need to be able to take quality jpegs for internet use.  This camera does a terrific job.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing...
Reviews.Author: Karen S. "gospursgo10"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes clear pictures and I love the video feature.  However, I have very fair skin and this camera gave my skin color a slight tint.  Almost a very light yellowish tint.  I had to use the skin tone corrector feature on every picture and adjust it to "lighter skin tones."  This gets very tedious.  Needless to say, it is now up for sale on eBay.  I am going to stick with Sony cameras.

Reviews.Title: The first Refurbished things i ever got
Reviews.Author: sharan
Reviews.Content: This was the most super amazing camera i ever owned. I did not know how much worth this piece of thing was worth until i lost it. Great camera at the time.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: SeeAndSay
Reviews.Content: I am still using this camera.  Most cams are now 16mpx.  This one is 10mpx.  But it makes great pix, very sharp.  Not much else to say, just a great little cam.

Reviews.Title: Best Powershot ever!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Kay
Reviews.Content: I'd owned this camera for about the past 5 years.  It was stolen in October when I was in Albuquerque.  I could not afford a new one so I bought this one used.  I also use a larger Canon EOS Rebel, but this particular camera is so easy to take when I go out with friends or just go out on a nature excursion.  It takes WONDERFUL pictures.  I really enjoy the micro lens on it as well.  Would recommend it highly.  Seller was very timely as well and followed up to make sure that I received it on time.

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: suspense "track fan"
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. It is small,portable, and ready for action.  Too bad it is very sensitive to white sand.  I ruined by camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: K. Martinez "K. Martinez"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 5 years and it works great. Have never had any issues with the shutter, images, etc. It works as if I had bought it yesterday. Photos are sharp, the camera is lightweight, fits well in pockets/purse, and is aesthetically appealing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: This was a good camera ...
Reviews.Author: SK "SK"
Reviews.Content: Canon is the one of the best. This camera was a good buy at the time. It took great pictures & was a good size. I gave it as a Christmas gift & they loved it.

Reviews.Title: awesome little pal
Reviews.Author: hantana
Reviews.Content: I got this for 3 years now and I have to say it's the best first camera I ever had. It has a lot of cool options for you to take a good picture (not professional but it's still good.) Just play with this camera and I know a lot of thing comes with it like how to take a picture of an object that close to the lens but it's still clear in the picture (simply choose the flower symbol which is macro), I'm saying this because I know a lot of people might not even know like my friends on Facebook trying to take a close up pictures and they're all blurry. That is one of the trick I learned by playing with my camera or just read the manual, it helps. The picture quality is pretty good especially out in the sun (it's probably because of the light). I hate it when the flash is always auto so sometimes I have to turn it off when I don't need flash. The color is pretty accurate to what objects you're taking; it might change because of the light and angle of where you're taking a picture. I also hate it how it doesn't tell you exactly when you need to charge the battery...like this one time I turned it on and the battery symbol looks full but 5 mins later, it warned me that it's out of battery. I hate that the most. Oh well, after all it's still a good camera for everybody (just not for professional purpose.)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: JCSMITH
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few years now and for a small compact camera, it does a great job. The picture quality is great for having a small camera. The charge doesn't take too long. I bought an extra battery just in case we needed it and it's come in handy when we've forgotten to charge the battery that's in the camera. Over all I think it's excellent for the price and I would recommend getting one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: I. Patcherezov
Reviews.Content: Have used it a lot in the last 2 years and it's been great.  Great photos and very pocket friendly. I lost the little strap so I dropped it and the battery compartment door broke, but it's still fine.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a few years now and really enjoy it. It's compact, easy to use, and takes great quality pictures. This is my second Canon and I'm sold on the quality. Video and audio are decent for a camera and I use it when I don't have a my video recorder handy.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: DesertIce "DesertIce"
Reviews.Content: I am using this Camera since 3 years and it rocks... very good quality for the price. I think it is the best among its peers....very happy about it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, ever!
Reviews.Author: Z. Jiake "TibDj"
Reviews.Content: This is my very first time to write a review! Not much to add here, but this is the greatest camera I have ever owned! My friends always amazed by the picture quality. Batter life is awesome, video record works great! I just love my camera! I highly recommend!But the prize now went up a bit on Amazon ($250), but still this is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for the casual user
Reviews.Author: Leticia Y. Carranza
Reviews.Content: I have been a Cannon fan ever since my first Powershot S230. I usually upgrade every year or two, to the latest and greatest powershot. Ever since I got this little beauty, I've stopped looking at the "latest and greatest". I have had the SD770is for almost three years now, and have no plans to "upgrade" any time soon. This little cam has every feature I could possibly want, the wonderful ELPH lens, and is the perfect size/shape for me. The only thing that makes the newer cameras better is the "megapizels", but who really needs more than 10 megapixels? To be honest, you don't really need more than 6 unless you're planning on blowing your pics up to poster size.  I love that the body is all metal, because it makes the camera sturdier (I've dropped this camera more than once, and it has not even a ding on it). I've taken the cam to three countries, and taken lots of pics with it, and I love it.If you're a professional photographer, you probably will never be satisfied with a point-and-shoot, no matter how good it is. But if you're like me, a tech-geek who wants to get great, frame-quality snapshots as easily as possible, then this is the camera for you. The image stabilization on this little beauty is priceless when you're on a tour bus trying to get a shot of something outside.Just for reference, I have a 2gb memory card in it right now, empty, and there is room for 463 pictures (on the top quality, top resolution setting) or 16 hours of video. So unless you're going on a long vacation where you'll have no access to a computer, you don't really need more than a 2-4gb for this cam.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: jimbo54
Reviews.Content: Excellent little point & shoot with the few remaining optical viewfinders which of course is not totally accurate but absolutely mandatory in bright, sunny, snowy conditions. Yes, it's noisy at higher ISO's but that's what my dSLR is for. I have had several of these and gradually gave them up to various family members so had to hunt long and hard for a replacement as they have been out of production for a while now. We have some excellent keepsake pictures from skiing trips and these cameras fit the bill perfectly. And no, I don't want to lug my dSLR equipment along as I'm lucky to stand up on those darn things (skis) much less with a larger backpack of camera gear. Just a very good little point & shoot to whip out for the task at hand.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Y. Zhu "YZ"
Reviews.Content: I love it. It is tiny, thin, and beautiful!the quality of pictures is excellent

Reviews.Title: great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: great image quality. video quality is also good. camera fits in my pocket. battery lasts a long time before needing to be charged.

Reviews.Title: A great P&S; camera that still holds it own today
Reviews.Author: K. B. Emmerling
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the quality of this camera after receiving it as a gift. Even with today's more advanced cameras, it still holds it own. The camera comes with a slew of features including image stabilization, face detection, different scene modes, manual controls for some features, and a great screen.  The feel of the camera is excellent and the battery life is also very good. During my 10 months of ownership I have managed to use the camera during mountain biking, hiking, and just walking down city streets.  The camera works well in many circumstances and is very easy to use.The pros include:Easy to use setupGreat LCD screenLong battery lifesturdy constructionThe negatives include:poor low light performance (common in P&S; cameras)slow focusing in low light (also common in other cameras)stabilization sometimes works well and sometimes notThe many features are easily used and one can even shoot limited videos with the camera.  The video features are for standard sized videos.  Perhaps the one problem with the camera is its performance in low light. Images often appear with large amounts of grain, even at iso set at 80.  This might be more of a problem with it being a P&S; camera with a small sensor.  The 3x optical zoom works fairly well but one should avoid using the digital zoom which leaves a great deal to be desired.The camera itself is easy to carry and handle.  The camera has a fast start up and fairly quick shooting mechanism in daylight.  Some of the best shots have come from up close macro shots using the 3x zoom.  Landscapes are nice done with proper lighting or lack of. During full daylight some landscape shots would come out white washed or with too much light.Overall a great camera to use all around. The camera was a great introduction to photography, even it wasn't a DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Stacey Hutton
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. My first one got stolen, but since I liked it so much I bought the same one again instead of a newer model. I can't find any faults with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Arnoldo L. Sanchez "Arnoldo Lopez."
Reviews.Content: It's a very good camera, good quality pictures. and the sdhc cards are inexpensive versus others like sony or olympus.It's my second canon digital camera and I'm glad.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Rocks!!!
Reviews.Author: Brian Garan
Reviews.Content: Love this thing. I've always used a Canon. I must say that I'm a big guy and I didn't think this particular model would be so small but I still love it. Takes quick pics and they always come out perfect. Great camera for great price.

Reviews.Title: excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: fuze
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera a year back and it has lived up to my expectations. i paid only a fraction of the currently advertised price and am very happy with the product performance. the only drawback i guess is the poor low - light performance but that was expected.

Reviews.Title: Compact and Reliable
Reviews.Author: The Man
Reviews.Content: This Camera takes great pictures. It is compact, portable and very reliable. Newer models may boast higher resolutions but you will not notice much difference unless you're a professional and in which case you should be looking at Canon pro series instead. For amateurs and casual users this canon is more than enough. The pictures can reveal incredible details. It may look small but it is powerful. Some of the pictures I took in the Detroit Auto Show look like Magazine Cut outs. This Camera is that good. I have owned it for a little over a year.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, handy size
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my SD770. It's far less plasticky than Canon's other offerings and feels more jewel-like with the extra metal. I tried a larger Canon 870 P&S; with a wider lens but just couldn't get over the bigger dimensions. The 770 is a perfect size to carry everywhere. I love how you can set the print button to almost whatever function you want. I have it set for the exposure function. The close-up feature is phenomenal. At less than a 400 ISO, I get very little noise. Video feature is really quite handy and useful. Battery life is incredible.Keep in mind that I shot professionally for thirteen years (Hasselblads and Canon F-1's) and now shoot with a Canon 40D, so I'm kind of particular about my image quality.My only gripe is that the battery cover has gotten really loose over time (have had the camera for a year), so I have to be careful to not open the cover when shooting, thereby shutting the camera down.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: M. evans
Reviews.Content: I recieved this camera for christmas last year (2008). The photo quality is exellent and there are many settings to get all the pictures looking perfect. I am still learning about the settings. there are so many!!! The battery lasts for a very long time, I will go for weeks without charging it. All my friends love my camera so much that many of them went out and got a camera too! I would however get an extra memory card. the one that is sent with this product only holds about 8 picts. Hope you enjoy it as much as i have!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: C. Taylor
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I was looking for.  It takes good pictures, I can slip it in my pocket and the rechargeable battery lasts a long time.  It's perfect for a family on the go.

Reviews.Title: Daughter loves it!
Reviews.Author: Kim Kirk "Krochet Kim"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my daughter. She has it with her constantly. She really likes the special effects that can be created with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Ajay "Ajay"
Reviews.Content: Got it as a gift to my dad last December.I should say i do not have any problems till now.Feature wise the IS (Image staabilization) and Face detection are worth while mentioning.This Camera starts very quickly from off to on mode however its a little late between the shots,but for an average user it shouldn't matter much as it is around 3 seconds.Battery life is good.The camera is so compact and very handy to carry in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Excelent performance for the bugs
Reviews.Author: E8a
Reviews.Content: I think this is an excelent camera for people that wants to capture their vacations, weedings and birthday parties, the face recognition and the image stabilization work wonderful, the color and picture quality mainly in interiors is excelent, I use it a lot in the Auto 6MP and medium setting because it makes pictures good enough for me, but i sometimes do use it in manual mode for taking pictures with no flash. The color accent and color swap features are great for making funy pictures. The only thing I miss from my old Nokia S1 is the great color it could capture in outdoor pictures with good light, for examples de landscapes of a sunny day, this Canon doesn't capture that good pictures in this conditions, for example the sky always turns a grayish color instead of the beatiful blue i could capture with the Nikon, in the other hand, the nikon had continous Auto ISO adjust, i mean it could capture pictures in any ISO between 50 and 400, the Canon has fixed ISO's 80, 100, 200, etc...Anyway, I'm happy with the camera and i think i would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: can't go wrong with canon
Reviews.Author: schonrph
Reviews.Content: bought this canon to replace my wifes old canon.  this is smaller but with a larger lcd screen.never had a problem with her old canon, so i decided to stick with canon and got her the sd770.you can't go wrong with canon, you may find cheaper cameras, but if you want great picture qualitygo with canon.  i bought this for her this past christmas (2008) for 159.00 and free shipping.  not surewhy the price has gone up, usually prices go down with electronics and the cheapest i have seen thiscamera now is 199.00.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: odessit
Reviews.Content: I bought it when it was on sale a couple of months ago, and it is great! The colors come out excellent, and the camera hasn't given me any issues as of yet (I took it overseas to places where the temperature is more than 100)!Great camera and I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Matma
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It came with a memory card (Amazon Special "thanks guys").  It takes great pictures, has a long battery life between charges, it does great short videos, and it is easily pocketable.

Reviews.Title: Just the right size camera
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: I recently went on vacation and used this camera instead of my much larger, heavier camera.  It was so much more convienent to just slip this camera into my pocket and go.  It was great.  I was able to pull it out at moments notice and get the shots I wanted.  It was great.  The only problem I had was when the batteries started to get low.  I did miss a few shots because the camera didn't flash as quickly as it did when the batteries were at full charge.  But the pictures were great.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: K. Harp
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and review reading before finally deciding on this camera. Let me start off by saying that I have a Nikon SLR but I wanted something small that I could carry in my purse just about every where but yet I didn't want to spend $200 or more.  I narrowed it down to two canons mainly becuase they still had an optical viewfinder and the nikons did not. I decided on this camera based on the price and the recharable battery. The other canon I was looking at was slightly cheaper, had 1x more optical zoom, but it used AA's and I hate AA's for camreas and it was not an Elph model.  When I bought this camera, Amazon had a much better price than the one I see now. If it had been the price I see now, I would not have bought it and would have suffered with the AA batteries on the other camera.Now that I have had a little time to play with this camera I can tell you that I love it! Its small, sleek, easy to use and takes great pictures! Since I have a toddler the setting I use the most is kids and pets and it takes great pictures of my little girl in motion! The prints have all come out nice and crisp and clear. I know I made a great choice and got quite a bit of bang for my buck! The camera fits great in my purse and I've even slipped it into my pocket a few times. I've only taken one video with it but I was very impressed by the sound quality of the video! My memory card is only a 1GB so plan on buying a larger one so I can take advantage of the video function more often!Never having owned a canon before I wasn't sure how easy it would be to figure out the settings. But just a few minutes with the instruction manual and I had most things down! I'm sure I'll go back to the manual for a few of the more advanced options but overall this camera is very user friendly.My only complaint is that I wish it did have more optical zoom. The olympus cameras seem to have a 5x and even the a series by canon that I was looking at had a 4x. The 3x on this one will do, but more would be nice.I highly recommend this camera if you can get a good price on it like I did. I would not pay over $200 for it however. There are just too many other options out there.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for about a month now and it is great.  I have no complaints to date.  I definitely suggest buying a large sd card to go with it.
