This camera is just an incremental update to previous models - nothing revolutionary, however the small details they did improve confirm there is not much they had to improve.Pros:* The price is great. I picked mine up for $140 on a Black Friday special - compare that to the $250+ a few years ago AND amazon.com gave me a free 4 GB SD card with it!* My fave feature after the price: Small, light, compact. Slips really easily into my jeans or jacket pocket.* The image stabilization appears to work very well. I've definitely noticed a little more crispness in my photos.* My previous Canon never had a problem with battery life and this one doesn't either.* I prefer the buttons to change settings used on the Canon rather than dials used on some Sony's that I was looking at. I found that the settings dials on the Sony tended to rotate when the camera was in my pocket. Changing settings on the Canon takes a firm depression of the buttons and I haven't had the same issue.Neutral:* I don't believe the 10 MP is that necessary - at least I don't use that much. I use it to hedge risk *in case* I ever print by archiving the full resolution.* The face recognition/focus feature is pretty cool but I haven't detected that much value in it.Cons:* I wish the screen was a little bigger, but understand the trade-off Canon made since making the screen bigger would have meant they couldn't have put in a view finder.* The size scale is not as granular as I would like. You can set pictures to 10 MP, 6 MP, 4 MP and a few others but not, for example, 8 MP. There may be technical details I'm not aware of OR the jump from 10 to 6 is the optimal one, but I would like a little more granularity.

Reviews.Title: We Love our Powershot!
Reviews.Author: B. Cluff
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect size to take anywhere and it takes GREAT pictures!  Very user friendly!  We've already got some fantastic photo's!

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gardner
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera. The Canon waterproof housing I bought was less than that--the second time I used it, it leaked and ruined the camera.But my comment here is on Canon's customer service. It took Canon two weeks to send me a replacement camera, and that shipment was lost by FedEx. However, when I contacted Canon to ask them to ship me another camera, they refused. They said that the problem was now between me and FedEx. I advised that I didn't have a relationship to FedEx, but that they did. My relationship was to Canon, and I asked that Canon give me another camera while it was waiting to be paid by FedEx for the lost camera. Three CSRs separately refused, and said that they can't fix a problem like this quickly.I told them that if I told Amazon that I'd not gotten a product from Amazon, it would ship a replacement immediately. They said they don't do things that way.So, be forewarned that if you have problems with this camera, you may encounter slow response and poor customer service.Next time, I won't buy Canon.

Reviews.Title: A Tale of Three Treasures!
Reviews.Author: Ms_Ladi "...just wandering the world."
Reviews.Content: This review is a combination of three:Canon PowerShot SD950IS 12.1MP (Titanium)Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP (Silver)Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MPI first purchased the Canon SD950, and after loonnnggg shipping from Jr.com, I received it and tried it out.  The camera is much bigger than the SD500 that I upgraded from--even though it's got so many bells and whistles.  One thing about Canon that's got my eyebrow raised:  Why the big font as if we can't read?The Image Stabilization is a wonderful thing, right along with the face detection.  It even focused on an enlarged print of a little girl!  The 3.7 zoom is nothing to frown at either.  ISO is easier to set now so one can play around with the settings...The camera is made for "big hands" and it took me about two weeks of off and on shooting to get used to it.  The 12MP quality is okay, and I didn't have to get used to too much new button placement.  One thing I didn't like is the play button.  I felt I had to really push my finger on the play button in order to view my photos.  It annoyed me enough to see what else was out there.The Canons SD770 and SD790 were next on my list.  Even though they were "only" 10MP, they had newer technology from Canon:  Motion Detection and Infinity and cute buttons in all new small packages.SD770IS(Silver)First the SD770.  This was a nice small camera!  Not cheap feeling at all, Canon packed everything but the kitchen sink in there.  I like the "Infinity" setting that the SD950 didn't have.  Also, I have the silver version and it's nice, small, sleek, and takes great pictures.  I didn't like the way the battery cover was not spring loaded.  Also, either it was this particular camera or the 770 in general, but it seemed like I had to "dig" for the battery and SDHC card once put in.  Yes, it's compact, hefty, and full of bells and whistles, but it was...kinda boring.  Maybe because the silver color didn't have the pizazz of the black version that I'd read reviews on.  Moving on to the SD790...SD790ISBigger camera!  Compared to the 770, it's a giant!  The same size as the 950 except in a square/cube like form.  The 950 is curvy, while the 790 is sleek and boxy (not sure if that's an oxymoron or not!).  The 790 also has a new button format that I'm not sure if I like or not.  I really enjoyed the SD500's button placement and while I can appreciate a "play" button...why not make it easy access instead of having to constantly press the button down?  I'm thinking that the play buttons will eventually wear out.  The big screen is nice, and even though I haven't used a viewfinder since...ever, it would be nice to "just have".  So the lack of a viewfinder is a potential bummer.  You never know when you gotta smear your nose on the photo screen to take pic!  lol  Also, the 790 is a fingerprint magnet.I tried to take the same pictures with all the cameras, but couldn't always (morning/evening, different zoom, etc.).  Both the 770 and 790 have high ISO settings (as did the 950), but I didn't even use anything that high previously!  All the pictures came out great.  Even my crappy pictures of my messy coffee table were clear and colorful!  One issue I had with all three cameras was the color accent setting.  It seemed as if I got better black and white/one color photos from my SD500 than either of these cameras.  I have to do a lot more tweaking.  However, it could be just because of the balances of the colors and the lighting effects in my environment.If I just had to choose based on portability, photos, looks, bells/whistles, ease of use, I would go crazy trying to decide.  Both cameras are amazingly small!  The thing that keeps me wondering about the 770 is, "how can they fit all these specs in this TINY camera!??  But, I'm a sucker for good looks, so the scale points back to the SD790!  True it's bigger than the 770, but it's still small considering the screen.  I always take great care of my electronics, so I'm not so worried about fingerprints.  If the button issue upsets me extremely, then I'll just upgrade to Canon's latest and greatest in 6-8 months.One more thing:  I purchased the SanDisk 4 GB Extreme III SDHC Card w/ MicroMate USB Reader and it gets 900ish pictures on the 10MP versions at the highest settings.Either way, can't wait to take pics on the new SD790.  I feel that although all three are great, the 790 has that sleekness with Canon's new technology all in one package.Get out, purchase any of these cams and you'd be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love...again!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Schwartz "Jennifer Schwartz"
Reviews.Content: When my previous canon snap shot camera was accidentally hit by a flying ball and broken (it's okay, accidents happen!) I was forced to go camera shopping. I didn't want to pay anymore than $200, so I was not able to replace it with the same model as my first one, even though I loved that lil' camera.  I decided to try a $150 Nikon...what a mistake!  I was not impressed with the photo quality whatsoever.  So, I found this camera, the Canon SD770, for around $200.  I love everything about it!  It has tons of scene modes that actually work right!  It's easy to use, has excellent photo quality, great battery life, I can't say enough good things about it.  We took it on vacation to Maui with us and it performed like a real trooper.  I purchased a $35 underwater pouch for it (see my other reviews) that I would highly reccomend you buy to go along with this camera. I give the camera an A+++!

Reviews.Title: why so much?
Reviews.Author: Keith Peterson
Reviews.Content: I bought this same camera for $159 with a free four gig memory card, and free shipping.  Why the big increase?.

Reviews.Title: User Friendly Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Ashrafi "20somethingirl"
Reviews.Content: Amazing product. I'm a die hard fan of Canon and this is definitely on par.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: H. O'Neill
Reviews.Content: bought to replace another canon camera i had and loved.. this camera lives up to what i wanted.. easy to use point and shot.. pretty quick btwn shot time. of course great quality.. and i love the size, since it fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Andre "There you go~"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of great reviews so that should tell you something...simply put, this is so easy to use and takes great photos.Buy it and enjoy, I am!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP
Reviews.Author: Margie
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)I love the slender size that fits my shirt pocket, but I keep it in my camera bag so that I know where it's at.  I don't always use the same shirt on a daily basis.  I also like the stabilizing effect the camera takes in my unstable hand as I snap.  The camera surprisingly takes crispy clear portrait pictures in any given weather.  The back-ground along with the portraits are also clear.  The zoom is very satisfactory too.  I can stand above a small clump of snow, aim straight down, snap, and the result looks like I knelt down to take a close-up picture.

Reviews.Title: Finally found the right camera...
Reviews.Author: Nathan Sneller
Reviews.Content: So, I purchased a Canon PowerShot A540 a couple years ago and had very few complaints. Took very nice outdoor pictures, while indoor pictures were kind of hit and miss. I thought I would upgrade after a couple years and got a nice deal on a PowerShot A650IS 12mp. This camera was  bad news from the start. Got the dreaded "lens error" within the first week and it took horribly blurry pictures all the time.Which leads me to the PowerShot SD770IS. I wasn't ready to give up on Canon just yet. The first thing I noticed was how beautifully vivid, crisp, and clean the pictures I got out of this camera were. It's size is very compact compared to the bulky A series. The battery life with the ion lithium battery is FAR superior to rechargable AA batteries.With a fully charged battery, we go days without having to recharge. We don't take tons of pictures necessarily, but we have a 2 year old daughter and need a camera at the ready to capture those priceless moments in her life. With the previous PowerShots we had, on numerous occasions, you would grab the camera to capture one those moments, only to find the batteries were dead and needed recharging. We always had to carry extra batteries with us.With the SD770IS, we have yet to run into that problem. And the picture quality is far superior. We just love it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera! No need for anything else
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Amazing that something with all the capabilities of the sd 770 are available at such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful colors, sharp images
Reviews.Content: Beautiful colors thanks to the DIGIC III processors, sharp images, needs very little post-processing. On the flipside  very little manual control and virtually zero depth-of-field tricks even in portrait or macro modes. Fair battery usage and the stabilized lens helps in night-photography. Overall a very good slim point and shoot, though if you want a bit more control or you plan to be a bit more serious about photography, go for the A590. It's cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD770 IS $159.00 WOW!
Reviews.Author: C. Matlack
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace our old Canon a610 5.0MP and wanted something smaller to carry around easily. Very very nice compact P&S; chock full of features that the average person will probably never even use but they are there when you want them. The other reason I picked this... It's A CANON.

Reviews.Title: Great camera....very happy with the purchase!
Reviews.Author: J. Rivera "Jay"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best!!!  Absolutely love it.  My first camera purchase ever and the pics are lovely!Definitely 5 stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SD770 IS
Reviews.Author: Country Farmer
Reviews.Content: This is the first Digital Camera that I've ever used or operated.  Before I ever purchased this particular camera I had read a lot of reviews online of verious cameras and narrowed my selection down to about three cameras.  Than came the after Christmas special prices and the discount that was offered I decided to purchase the SD 770 IS.  So far I am pleased with the quality of pictures, but I have some problem with all the different settings that are on this little thing.  Once I get myself aquinted and use it more I think this is the cats meow.  So far I really like.

Reviews.Title: Very light and compact
Reviews.Author: SS "SS"
Reviews.Content: I've always had cannon, I like this one a lot because its light, compact, and fits in my purse and for the average point and shoot photographer like me, its great.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Georgia mom"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Canon and I've loved all of them.  I upgraded to the 770 and can tell the difference the Image Stability makes.  Its small size and lightweight so I can carry it with me all the time.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Marcantel
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  Easy to use & great product for the money.  I certainly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Vishal A. Pathak "Vishal PAthak"
Reviews.Content: I am immensely satisfied with the product. The picture quality is awesome and the piece is very handy. I will give 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Kyle
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I purchased the Canon Powershot SD770. I was torn between the SD790 and the SD770. I am very happy with my purchase! At the time the two cameras were about $30 apart in price but I read reviews that said the battery life in the SD790 wasn't as great due to the increased size of the viewing screen. I had a Canon Powershot SD400 before so the SD770 already provided a larger viewing screen than I was used too. The camera is excellent quality and the pictures come out fantastic plus the battery life is great! Canon is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: It's a great product!
Reviews.Author: Julia "Julia"
Reviews.Content: This type of camera is better than my expectation. It produce pictures with very high quality and it's appearence looks pretty. I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Exellent
Reviews.Author: M. De Lourdes Bejar "Lulu"
Reviews.Content: I purchese this camara for my enlaw for christmas and she love it.  I'm happy for her and I love price and the shipping was fast! thank you!

Reviews.Title: Snapping Great Shots
Reviews.Author: Shirley A. Gallegos
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my purchase of the Canon Powershot SD 770 IS. I am happy with the features of the camera and the service I received. The only negative would be the very small memory on the memory card that came with the camera. Fortunately I had a memory card from my previous Canon that was compatable that had much more memory. I am enjoying my new camera and taking many pics.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper "Jeanne"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD770 IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)This camera was a replacement for my last Canon camera that finally gave up.  I am really pleased with the light weight and slim design.  It takes quality pictures and movies.  It is very easy to use....pretty much point and shoot with the ability to do much more if desired.  I am very happy with it overall.

Reviews.Title: Good quality camery with low price
Reviews.Author: Andy St "Andre"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased camera for gift. Compare with sony which has 12mpxl, nikon, olympus. Canon is cool! yeasy to operate, good quality picture. Best camera in the middle section.

Reviews.Title: Powershot SD770 camera
Reviews.Author: R. Caruso
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my husband and he has been thrilled with it.  He is very satisfied with the quality of the pictures and ease of use.  One of the features he most wanted in a smaller camera was a decent size view screen and this one fits the bill.  He is having a great time documenting all the details of the latest construction project we're completing in our home.

Reviews.Title: Canon Fan
Reviews.Author: Arthu P. Fortunato
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this camera. It has all the features I needed. I have 3 toddlers and it can be difficult gettting them to stay in one place for pictures. The in motion pictures are a plus there's no blur. I would definitely recommend this product and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Angela Susan "Kitchen Witch"
Reviews.Content: I got my husband this camera for Christmas.  He loves it.  He wanted a lightweight pocket-sized camera for hiking and documenting his woodworking projects.  He has found it mostly intuitive to use and hasn't really found anything yet that he doesn't like about it. He really likes the fast response between pressing the button and taking the photo as we also own an older Sony that has a moment's delay that he finds annoying to use.  He also likes the compact battery recharger.  Perhaps best of all, the quality of photos he has taken so far has exceeded his expectations.  As for me, I think the camera was a great price from Amazon at $159.00.

Reviews.Title: Compact, easy-to-use and great product
Reviews.Author: Hashbaugh "Hashbaugh"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great buy: efficient and affordable. My only complaint is that before you take a picture, the display is incredibly grainy. (Fortunately, the picture turns out great, just a little deceptive at first.)I haven't printed photos yet, but they have been perfect as digital images!

Reviews.Title: A lot of Power in THIS Canon!
Reviews.Author: W. VANORDEN "...mentally illustrated"
Reviews.Content: My wife is a BRAND LOYAL Canon camera diehard, and has four favorite cameras to bring with us on all of our trips...of which I get to lug..... Happy ME... anyway, as a surprise for her, I wanted to UPGRADE her older digital cameras with the newest POINT AND SHOOT for our short trips. After a lot of research, and reading the great reviews for THIS model, I decided that THIS was the camera just right for my wife's needs....my FINAL deciding factor was the PRICE! -- Amazon had this camera for the same price as older models, but with more bells and whistles.....I HAD to get this one, and I AM VERY GLAD THAT I DID!!! - Upon opening her Christmas gift, she looked at me as if I had a hole in my head...but This Canon SD770 IS has become her "GO TO" camera for whatever she wants to capture......it IS a little powerhouse, and a GREAT buy!!--THANK YOU AMAZON and CANON.... you have SAVED MY SHOULDER!!!  -- MINKWHEEL

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Bortnick
Reviews.Content: This camera is nearly perfect for a non tech person like me.  The cost is extremely reasonable and the directions in the manual and on the camera are simple and intuitive.  The software is easy to use although photo manipulation, enhancement, and saving seemed easier with my old Canon Zoom Browser and PhotoStitch.  This camera, its battery and SD cards are very light and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Shawn Campbell "shawnski"
Reviews.Content: Pros : Good sized screen, Good Battery Life, Easy to Use, Excellent in Low Light, Nice Features and Settings, Great Resolution, Fast Shutter Speed, Great ZoomBest Uses : Sports/Action, Travel, Weddings/Events, Everyday Photos, Outdoors, Home, PortraitsI was looking for a great camera with great quality pictures but at not such a great budget. I thought that those expectations were unrealistic but then I stumbled across this camera at a great price and I had heard great things about it. I caould not have made a better purchase! The crystal clear quality amazes me every time! Money well spent. Go buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Cannon SD 770 IS
Reviews.Author: Charles Tweed "Charles T."
Reviews.Content: Hello,  I got this camera over Christmas holidays and have been very pleased with it so far performs as expected , maco shots are also very clear and impressive for the price appears to be worth what i paid and a solid  little camera. I have big hands so needed the strap  because it is kinda small but was aware of this defintely a compact type camera  and also since have gotten a case with screen protecter  since receiving the camera I read the reviews as well before buying and is all I expected it would be , very pleased with.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bill "Bill"
Reviews.Content: After buying the wife the Canon 1100, I was impressed and had to replace my Canon 540 for the smaller model ,got the SD770 ,Great compact and more features and haven't seen it cheaper than I paid here at Amazon .If you get the HC SD card spend a bit more and get the SD 6 ,which is the faster card.

Reviews.Title: A great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Joanna Jutsum "Erratic Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with the Canon SD770IS.  I wanted a camera that would fit easily in 'girl jean pockets' and it does.  The controls are intuitive and I have yet to read the manual.  The construction feels solid and the startup time is negligible.  Overall I am very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: Jo  Jo
Reviews.Content: I'm the non-tech grandmother who received an Elf....because it really is easy to use, small, and its a gift for any age.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Andres Dehais
Reviews.Content: This camera is an up-grade from sd1000, the extra features worth it... 10 megapixels, plus the digital image stabilizer, not to mention the ISO 3200 option.  It is a well rounded camera (Cannon reputation) at under $160.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Owned Yet - Highly Recommend a Canon
Reviews.Author: Sonia Davis "sheb"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera about July '08, so I have had it for about six months.  I love this camera.  It takes great pictures.  I get better pictures than I've gotten with any other cameras so far.  Love it much more than my old Sony digital camera.  I wanted to try a Canon, because I've heard they were the best digital cameras, and I settled on this one after reading all the reviews and seeing the high megapixel on there (my last camera was only a 3 or 4 megapixel).  I was not disappointed at all.  It is extremely easy to use for me and for anyone I hand it to to take a picture.  I had some of my wedding pictures taken with this camera and some of them turned out just as nice as the photographers pictures.  Can't wait for more opportunities to use this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Glenn Higginbotham "UGA Fan"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little camera.  It'll do just about anything, except wash dishes (and they probably make an attachment that will alow it to do that too).  Can't beat the quality of the pictures!  Small enough to carry in a shirt pocket.  Another plus is - the flash attachment I bought for my A640 works perfectly with this little jewel too!  I have no hesitation recommending this camera to any digital camera buff.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jay "Steven"
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality camera. Although, only 3x zoom. could use 4 or 5x zoom. 10 MP gives very detail pictures. Great camera. Would recommend highly. Fast Shipping.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Morin "not a muffin"
Reviews.Content: This is the third Elph camera I've owned. I love how intuitive the buttons and menus are, and how compact and portable the camera is. It does take great pictures, and it even has some really nifty bells and whistles (color swap, color accent, red eye correction) to boot. I bought a refurb, so I wasn't surprised when I noticed a small purple spot on the LCD last week. It doesn't show up on the photos, just the screen, so I can't complain about that. The only thing that's disappointed me so far is the amount of noise I notice in some of my low-light pictures. I also own an SD 600 Elph, and I don't notice as much noise in those photos. A lot of the time, it's barely noticeable, though.All in all, I'm very happy with it. I do have a Canon Rebel for those times when I need much higher quality, but that doesn't come with me everywhere. This camera doesn't leave my side. EVER.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: C. Moua
Reviews.Content: Takes great quality pictures, video's, sleak, and clean design. Comes with easy to use software for pulling out both photo's and video's.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: clairellen
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this camera, a gift for our daughter.  The order was placed accurately, delivered within 3 days.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised.
Reviews.Author: Martin J. Coady
Reviews.Content: I choose this model to replace a Panasonic Lumix of a few years because of its much smaller size. The camera works as advertised. It is easier to use than the Lumix, lighter and more versatile. I am still on the learning curve but can heartily recommend it to anyone wanting a highly portable camera.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Size Camera
Reviews.Author: Viv
Reviews.Content: Wonderful,ready to use camera when there is a photo moment.No bulk,fits in purse or shirt pocket.Great camera.

Reviews.Title: A Little Digital Camera with Class
Reviews.Author: K. Gaeta
Reviews.Content: A friend has this camera and I've always loved it so purchasing this was no-brainer!  GREAT quality camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera best price!
Reviews.Author: L. Henry "gobucks"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the best price can find!I wanted a small digital camera with a decent size screen, high mega pixal and a quick shutter speed. This camera had it all and with the 16 GB memory card I will never have to worry about picture storage again (4000 pictures at the highest quality).I am continually impressed with the picture and video quality. I am now a Cannon person for life!

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures & Compact Size
Reviews.Author: MacFan
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. It is also easy to use and very small (wife carries it in a pocket in her purse). She loves it. It was also highly rated on steves-digicams website.

Reviews.Title: Better than most Point-and-Shoot at this price
Reviews.Author: R. Ho
Reviews.Content: Relatively good picture quality.  My old Canon point-and-shoot has RAW, wish this one has it too.  Viewfinder a bit tiny but still better than none at all.  Very light and makes for a very good pocket camera where you do not want to lug along a bulky DSLR.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany M. Palmieri "tpalm"
Reviews.Content: i'm still learning all the features of this camera, but i really love it. it's easy to use and the pictures turn out great!

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value!
Reviews.Author: Clifford Z. Truempy "Thumper"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several digital cameras since the 1990's and I bought the Canon A590 IS for simple point-and-shoot situations.  I am amazed at the quality of the pictures as well as the image stabilization that really works well.  Additionally, I take a lot of macro pictures and its capability in this area is fantastic.  I am simply incredulous that they are able to offer so many features and such high quality images in this one little camera for so little money.  This is surely the all-time bargain in digital cameras for the price, and I would recommend this A590 IS to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Low Price.
Reviews.Author: Demian Dellinger
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. I got it to replace another canon that I lost.The battery life on this thing is absolutely incredible. It literally lasted through a few couple days of taking many pictures and videos and with very frequent playback from an enthusiastic 7 year old.It takes GREAT pictures in bright sunny light and with flash. That said, the quality in lower light is good (good to good+) but not great (at least while using it handheld on automatic settings, I'm sure manually set and on a tripod it would be excellent).For a point and shoot this is a superb choice.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter for christmas.  It works great.  It's simple enough for her to use independently (she's 14) and takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Glenda Hockersmith "Glenda Hockersmith"
Reviews.Content: This Camera is amazing. It was straight out of the box, point and click, ready to go.  It takes great pictures. It is perfect for someone like me that just wants to point and click and have the camera do the work.I love it. The price on Amazon was a great deal !!!! The size of the camera is a real plus also. It fits in your purse, you hardly know it is there.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot dig camera
Reviews.Author: Jenn W "Jenn"
Reviews.Content: Delivery & service for item was good, though is was back ordered, did come in amount time. Product is excellent, would recommend anyone to get it here!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice pictures and movies.
Reviews.Author: G. M. Volk
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed that such a small camera can take such good pictures.  There are so many features packed into it, but for the most part you can just leave it on auto and get good shots.  The best thing about this is the size.  I have two kids, and we have enough stuff to lug around when we goto the park or the zoo and my old camera was just getting to heavy to hang around my neck.  This camera easily slipped into my front pants pocket!  So far, very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Robert Mclean
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas.  I did a fair amount of research on-line and based upon the many stellar reviews I found for this camera and the great price point,  I made the purchase.  My wife loves this camera.  It is the perfect point and shoot style.  The small size and weight make it incredibly portable and the 10MP resolution gives us great pics.  A lot of nice features for the money.  I love having the viewfinder for outdoor use during the day in a snowy climate as all screens get washed out in the glare.  In normal conditions the screen provides great resolution and feedback.  Image stabilizer has been great.  I'm really happy with the camera for the price!My only complaint about the buying process has nothing to do with the camera.  I wanted to buy the suggested memory card with the camera during the same transaction.  however since the memory card came from a different supplier than the camera, Amazon was going to charge me $11 to ship a $10 item.  So then I had to go buy a card from the store locally.  I would have liked to take care of both at the same time, but couldn't justify the shipping....

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Scott R. Jones "Scott"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera to carry with you.  Fits in your pocket and takes very nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Review 2
Reviews.Author: Jay H. Van Groningen
Reviews.Content: I love this Canon Powership SD770 IS 10MP Digital Camera. It came just in time for Christmas celebrations. I have tons of photos (beautiful photos) to keep the memories alive. I do a lot of corporate training, and this little camera is a perfect fit to capture the events: small, light weight, easy to view images.

Reviews.Title: Great Camara for the price
Reviews.Author: G. Rogers "Sub Vet Cold War Warrior"
Reviews.Content: Had all the features I wanted and was on sale.  Works as well as the last Cannon I got, I like this camera.

Reviews.Title: good little camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Garcia "JAG"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this product, the pictures are excellent and the size of the camera is great, it can fit in my shirt pocket, lots of good features! very happy with this purchase!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Ruth Kantor
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter in college, she loves it. Great camera and a great Amazon price, thanks Amazon! We are a diehard Canon family. Great cameras!

Reviews.Title: Good mobile camera
Reviews.Author: NiK
Reviews.Content: positives:it's a great mobile camera, easy to carry, zoom is OK, easy to use and make settings.negatives:Though it says it has image stabilization, the pictures will have chromatic abberation or distortion if the camera is shaken while taking pictures.If the pictures are taken properly without shaking the camera, its a great one for a great price

Reviews.Title: It is exactly what I have expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Raincat"
Reviews.Content: This is a good little camera. At this price, this is a good all around camera. I was surprised at nice quality of the video. This is a major improvement to my 4 year old camera. Cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product from canon
Reviews.Author: Pranav Raval
Reviews.Content: This is a light weight winderful camera.I loved this product.Quality and design is excellent.

Reviews.Title: excellent pics
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, the pics I have taken are of great quality and I love the red eye function. I definately recommend this camera to anyone who loves to take pics.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jude "Jude"
Reviews.Content: It is very versatile. Its size makes it convenient. Many options. I gave it to my husband for Christmas. He loves it. He carries it everywhere, even on his runs.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Used to have a Kodak EasyShare Dx7630 and I really like it until I compared the photo quality to the Canon.  The PowerShot is so small and sleek and it takes very high quality pictures.  I love all the features.  The only feature that have difficulty with is the color accent- difficult to focus.  Otherwise, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Burns
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and viewable area when taking pictures. I haven't used all the features but on the whole its a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: MavelHeros
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife one month ago, and it's really nice. She like it. Everything works well, no surprise. The quality of photo is good for its price, and the battery is strong. I would like to recommend this to my friend.But one little problem I got is that, once the video on the disk exceeds 100M, I got problem transmitting it to my computer. Now I still have not figured out what's going on.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality, sleek design and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Prem Naveen
Reviews.Content: I was even amazed at the quality of the vedio that was captured and sound quality was brilliant

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: Brian C. Handy
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the choice and the recommendations we received from this site.

Reviews.Title: Great camera !
Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper
Reviews.Content: I started with a Canon PowerShot 4 years ago and a trip to Disneyworld for Christmas was my motivator for buying this one.  BTW---my 4 year old PowerShot still works perfectly.  I wanted the video option which I did not have on my older PS.I am not a techie and found this camera easy to use.  VERY easy.It is lightweight and slips right into my pocket.The pictures are great----nighttime, indoor and outdoor.The battery life is amazing.  I took 483 photos at WDW and charged the battery pack twice.I highly rec. this camera to the "average" digital camera customer.As a grandmother just needing great pics of my family, this camera totally fills the bill.

Reviews.Title: Excelente actualización en Canon
Reviews.Author: Juanito
Reviews.Content: Anteriormente contaba con una cámara Canon 550 de 4 MP y este cambio  me ha resultado muy ventajoso.  Muchisimo mejor resulución, diseño muy compacto y la duración de la pila es muy buena, hasta la fecha no he tenido que suspender sesiones de fotos por falta de pilas, aun con uso extensivo de flash y video.  Los menus son muy similares al de la 550, así que el cambio fué facilísimo.

Reviews.Title: LOOKED AT THE REST, BUT BOUGHT THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I did many days worth of research in order to upgrade from my old Canon A95 and decided on this camera. Love everything about it.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Charles Lewis "Chaplin"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my Olympus 8 Megapixel that got damaged, great camera was quite impressed, Canon contiues with their excellent line of products, now I need to try and obtain a Canon SLR when I can.

Reviews.Title: nice camera, finicky controls
Reviews.Author: Mark H. Webster
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera but returned it after a week. It has a control dial sort of like an ipod that allows you to navigate through the menus. You press on it lightly and spin it around. I continually fought with that dial while trying to select menu items. I have a canon digital rebel xt SLR already, but needed something lighter to carry up rock climbs where the big slr is too heavy. It didn't help any that my big fingers are covered in heavy caluses which prevent me from feeling my way around the super sensitive scroll wheel dial. After a couple of my fellow climbers tried it and couldn't make it work either, I returned it and bought the canon sd1100 elph. It is only 8 megapixels, but it has the older style rocker dial (like my rebel xt) for navigating menus and I find it much more user friendly. Picture quality on both cameras is about what you'd expect from a point and shoot. Surprisingly good considering how small they are, but for really important shots I will need to carry my SLR and that's ok. Each camera has it uses. I did love the fact that this little camera can do short movies. They are lots of fun to mess around with. This camera also fits perfectly in a watertight otter box. $11 at rei and it's bombproof in there.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Sd850is
Reviews.Author: M. Rajic
Reviews.Content: Great solid camera, loved mine so much, bought one for the wife. Canon products are solid and I own several others. (3-mp600 printers / sd1000, sd850is cameras).

Reviews.Title: Canon's Warranty Program is Defective
Reviews.Author: robwi "Rob"
Reviews.Content: Be aware that if your Canon camera fails within the first year of ownership, you may be charged $109, ("Flat rate repair charge, + shipping") to get your camera repaired. If you are talking about a $200 camera, would you pay that? If you are deciding between two different brands, factor this in.

Reviews.Title: So easy to use even a girl can use it
Reviews.Author: Scottso "Scottso"
Reviews.Content: Purchased two for my girls to take to college, reasonable price, good quality, clear sharp images, fits in a purse or tight jeans survived beer pong and God knows what else and so easy a girl can use it!!Hey my girls are getting their PhD's, I'm the C student lol

Reviews.Title: PowerShot SD770 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric E. Auerbach
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)I bought the camera very recently and have not used it very much, but I can make the following comments.  The camera's capabilities go far beyond my present needs.  The instruction manual is very detailed, but I still found it frustrating in some instances.  However, Canon's on-line help screens are very, very good, and if that is not adequate, then they are responsive to direct questions.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Power Shot SD770 IS prior to our vacation to the Grand Canyon. I had done several hours of research on point and shoot cameras and it always led me back to the Canon brand and then to the SD 770.After returning home from vacation I downloaded the pictures to our computer. I was very impressed with the picture quality. The pictures were sharp and the colors were very true. I had taken about 200 pictures and the battery was still at full charge. Just for kicks I enlarge one of the pictures to 8.5X11 and was amazed at the clarity!I have used the view finder quite a bit, especially in direct sunlight and extreem darkness--a great feature as well as the large flash. The camera is small and fit easily in my shirt pocket.If I had to note any concern about this camera it would be that it should be handled with care since a sudden impact would probably render it useless. I guess many cameras would fit into that category.A great little point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Helen Salisbury
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed that Canon has not given up on using a propriatary battery in their cameras.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for me.
Reviews.Author: R. Lankswert
Reviews.Content: I am a grandmother and it is terrific to have a Canon small enough to slip in my pocket.  I even got a picture yesterday of my eight year old grandson's first foul shot because the camera was handy.  HE MADE IT!  We tried the movie filming and it worked great.  The LCD viewer is big and easy to see.  The operations are easy to figure out.  I bought two extra 4GB memory cards and one extra battery.  It comes with the charder.  Never again am I going to be caught with a run down battery and no memory left on my card.  I find this the perfect arrangement for me.  I wish I had bought the camera case.One other BIG ADVANTAGE is the fact that CANON is the number 1 best company to deal with when you are trying to work with your camer or to have it repaired.  CANON is the best.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD770
Reviews.Author: M. Curcio
Reviews.Content: Amazon has a fine, fine deal on the Canon PowerShot SD770 IS Silver Digital Camera. It includes a 16GB SD card (make sure to add both to your cart) and it's $179 + free shipping = $179 shipped!The camera offers great features at a small convenient size.  * 10 megapixel CCD with a 3x optical zoom  * Face detect, motion detection tech, 2.5-inch color LCD and SD/SDHC card slot

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: James P. Critzer
Reviews.Content: its great, a little slow on the burst mode compared to some, but its really awesome overall.

Reviews.Title: Only purchase if you plan to keep in the box at all times!
Reviews.Author: NC Mom
Reviews.Content: I'm so sad because I purchased this camera 3/09 and it's dead after 4months..deemed unrepairable by Canon because of water damage.  I would admit if this had been dropped in the toilet or even just around water exposed, but it has only been used under normal conditions!  And if I can't put my camera in my purse or in a sealed pocket of the diaper bag or on the countertop then it's not the camera for me or most people I would imagine.  My old kodak which became the kid's play camera after purchasing the new one and which has been dropped a zillion times and probably submerged in water is still working just fine.  It was a great working camera, but as a mom and someone who brings my camera everywhere..beach, park, preschool...I need something more durable!

Reviews.Title: Temporary investment only
Reviews.Author: K. H. Miller
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 18 months now, and have never been wholly satisfied. I ought to have returned it, but am a terrible procrastinator, and had done much research to select this one. It's my last (and THIRD) Canon Elph.I find the quality control on Canon Elph to be dismal. The gyroscope didn't work consistently after a month, so rotating the camera to look at pics was a pain.The focus features in auto and manual modes were not as clear as my previous model, somewhere in the 400s. Contrast was fuzzy.Many silly features that didn't seem to do much for the photos.It survived one drop onto concrete from standing height (abt 37" at waist), which pleased me  no end! However, the second fall it took, from my 8-y-0 waist height, onto carpet, was its death sentence.The extending lens is jammed, and Canon's cost to look at the thing = $45 and repairs start at $130.That's more than half the cost of a new one.I bill this as a disposable camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PwerShot SD770 IS
Reviews.Author: Djar "proud mommy"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because a friend has a similar model by Canon. All I can say is how disappointed I was in the quality of the pictures. I am not sure if I just had a bad camera or if one of the reviews I read was right and this little camera is NOT able to handle the 10 megapixel. EVERY picture in EVERY setting had a lot of noise (blurry/grainy).I returned it within the 30 days that Amazon allows (best return service out there when it comes to cameras) and replaced it with the Canon Powershot SD-1100. I like it MUCH better but I have to say that my 7 year old Kodak digital takes the best pictures out of any camera I have owned but it is no longer functioning right so it had to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara
Reviews.Author: Mario Rodriguez "Mario R"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD770 IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)Esta camara es excelente, camara pequeña y muy buena calidad de fotos. Las fotos en movimiento salen excelente. La recomiendo. Excelente camara.

Reviews.Title: Great little compact camera
Reviews.Author: G. Jakins "shuttermom"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon Elph camera (my first went in the ocean with my husband on a fishing trip).  I use a Canon 30D when I need all the bell and whistles, but this little camera goes with me when I don't want to lug the big one around.  Easy to use and the picture quality is great!

Reviews.Title: No driver for XP 64-bit available
Reviews.Author: Villagorilla
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, it is ok. However XP 64-bit does recognize the camera but Canon is unable or unwilling to provide a driver for XP 64-bit. They suggest to use a card reader which is extremely inconvenient.My Casio Exilim is automatically recognized by XP 64-bit, so better get a different brand when you run XP 64-bit.Not a good service from Canaon though.BTW: XP 64-bit is much better than Vista (faster) and does not have the 4 GB limit.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sd770 is 10mp digital
Reviews.Author: Dennis Delagrange
Reviews.Content: When delivered it would NOT work,  I had to send it back to the company for repairs.  This was very annoying, time consuming and postage/insurance was expensive.  Canon did fix it now it works OK.  Why sould something brand new have to be repaired?

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Donna Richeson
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Canon digital camera for 4 years -- the old Ixus.  It has been a true work horse.  Since I do a fair amount of photography for a blog, I noticed this camera had more megapixels, slimmer case for carrying in pocket, a good-sized LCD screen and a very reasonable price.  I ordered it excitedly.  Of course all I thought about were the perceived advantages.  The camera menu and options are so complex and sophisticated that it took an electrical engineer, and computer techie and a 15 year old who uses electronics all the time -- plus the manual -- to even begin to figure some things out.  Very stressful.  After I took photos and plugged it into my computer to import photos to my iPhoto library -- it was chaotic.  The software was different now, and we did use the disk that came with it.  Photos no longer showed up in a linear fashion -- they were interspersed with old photos from way back.  We could not remedy this.  Well, I could go on about the difficulties, but I imagine you get the idea as a possible customer.  I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: avoid powershot cameras
Reviews.Author: Steven Podnos
Reviews.Content: I bought the Powershot S2 IS on amazon just over a year ago..  worked fine till just out of warranty, then all the pictures began to come our overexposed.  I sent it into Canon and they want 157 dollars to repair it or replace with a refurbished model.  It cost 259 new!  I wrote them and told them that I expected a lightly used expensive digital camera to work more than one year, but no dice.  I'll never buy another Canon.  Beware!

Reviews.Title: Battery did not work
Reviews.Author: C. J. Sutton
Reviews.Content: We had to return the product because the power did not turn on.  I suspect there was a problem with the battery or charger.

Reviews.Title: Price for this item and amazon support is very bad
Reviews.Author: Narayana Sama
Reviews.Content: This iteam price is very similar product my friend recived with a low price and also a 4gb card so compare to other online shopping stores AMAZON customer support is very bad.

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled!  Poor description.
Reviews.Author: Fred Becker "Lottie's Dad"
Reviews.Content: Our last camera (a Canon Powershot S410) recently went on the fritz, so we started to research a new camera.  All of the reviews and ratings led us to purchasing the Canon SD790IS.  HOWEVER, no product review on Amazon or even the product description page informed us that the flash card that was included with the camera was only intended as a 'test card'.  We were so excited to use our new camera and then after only three photos and a FOUR second video, our camera started to flash "Memory Card Full".  We called Canon's Customer Service thinking something was wrong with our camera; however, they informed us that the 32MG flash card included with the camera was only intended to 'test' the camera to make sure it worked.  We actually called Canon Customer Service again to be sure this was correct information.  Well, it was apparently correct, and we were without a doubt annoyed that this information was not more prevalent in the product description.  The bottom line is this: BE AWARE that the camera does not work by just taking it out of the box.  You will need a flash card in addition to your purchase of the camera.  We just purchased an 8 GB card that won't arrive until next week, so we are still without a camera.  If we had known this information a bit sooner, it most likely would have affected our decision as to which camera to purchase in terms of budget.  DON'T BE FOOLED LIKE WE WERE!  As an aside, for anyone who is debating purchasing the Canon accessory kit (camera case, extra battery, and strap), we were very happy with the case, and you can't beat having an extra real Canon battery.

Reviews.Title: I dont can to see the status tracking shipping, 7 days
Reviews.Author: R. A B
Reviews.Content: I dont can to see the status tracking shipping is very late for delivery 7 days I paid for and dont know for my shipping order

Reviews.Title: I hate amazon.
Reviews.Author: Mei Li "Mei Li"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera on black Friday. It said that If I buy it from amazon, I can get a 4G memory card for free. However, they ordered it twice and did not send the memory card. And when I call the customer service, they refuse it. It is unbelievable. I am very angry.
